data.title: What Has Lucas Grabeel Been Up To Since 'High School Musical'?
data.meta_description: Since most teen and child stars headline movies and shows that young people can relate to, they tend to be the actors that people go on to be the most nostalgic about. For example, these days there are loads of people who feel intense feelings of nostalgia for the stars of the High School Musical
data.text:
Since most teen and kid stars headline movies and presentations that younger other people can relate to, they have a tendency to be the actors that individuals move on to be the most nostalgic about. For example, at the moment there are loads of people who feel intense feelings of nostalgia for the celebs of the High School Musical trilogy.

When the general public take into consideration the stars of the High School Musical franchise, it is other people like Zac Efron, Vanessa Hudgens, and Ashley Tisdale that come to mind first. One of the main reasons for that's that despite the fact that Lucas Grabeel performed a pivotal role within the High School Musical motion pictures succeeding, many former lovers have misplaced track of him since then. That begs an obvious question, what has Grabeel been up to since High School Musical?

Related: 15 Child Stars Who Think They're Still FamousâBut Aren't

Taking The World By Storm

Before the 2006 release of High School Musical, it seems likely that the powers that be at Disney had measured expectations for its performance. However, after the film debuted on Disney Channel, it become an absolute sensation. Furthermore, the film would go on to do large business as soon as it was once launched on house video.

Given the huge good fortune that High School Musical loved, it didnât take lengthy for it to get a sequel that arguably was much more popular than the unique. In truth, High School Musical 2 was once such a massive success that the remaining movie within the sequence was once launched in theaters. Of course, there have been different TV methods that made the leap to the big display screen but it is nonetheless superb every time that happens. To the surprise of absolutely nobody, High School Musical 3: Senior Year carried out extraordinarily well and it additional cemented the franchiseâs legacy.

Related: Everything Zac Efron Has Done Since 'High School Musical'

Continuing Career

Since High School Musical 3: Senior Year was released in 2008, Lucas Grabeel has achieved an awful lot. For example, even supposing Lucas Grabeel isnât a big movie celebrity, that doesnât imply that he hasnât appeared on the giant display screen over the last twelve years. Unfortunately, most of the movies that Grabeel starred in failed to make a lot of an affect, including The Legend of the Dancing Ninja, I Kissed a Vampire, and Dragon Nest: Warriors' Dawn. However, Grabeel did appear in a few notable motion pictures, College Road Trip and Milk.

Over the remaining a number of years, Lucas Grabeel has enjoyed the majority of his good fortune as a TV famous person. For example, Grabeel played Superboy during an episode of Smallville, he competed on Chopped, and he starred in the sitcom Switched at Birth. Grabeel has also confirmed himself to be an completed voice actor in recent times as he has contributed to presentations like Family Guy, Robot Chicken, Elena of Avalor, Doraemon, and Spirit Riding Free. On best of all the ones roles, up till recently, Grabeel voiced the principle personality in the Nickelodeon and Netflix animated collection Pinky Malinky.

Related: 15 Best Animated Movies To Watch On Netflix

Looking Back

When High School Musical: The Musical: The Series debuted on Disney+, it made numerous lovers of the franchise glance back on the motion pictures they loved all over their youth. Since Lucas Grabeel made an appearance during an episode of High School Musical: The Musical: The Series, he wound up collaborating in a chain of interviews. During those conversations, Grabeel spoke about his original High School Musical tenure and he had some interesting issues to say.

While talking to TV Line in 2019, Lucas Grabeel spoke about the public perception of his High School Musical persona and the personal dialog that knowledgeable how he portrayed him. "People have always asked me if Ryan was gay. I've seen a lot of performances from the tours or high schools or community theaters, and they always take Ryan to that place of being way over the top. That's fine, but that's not exactly the way I played it. I had a lot of talks with [director Kenny Ortega] about his own experience in high school. He was not out, and he wasn't running around being that way, but he had that energy inside of him."

During a 2020 look on TMZ by means of video chat, Luca Grabeel admitted that even supposing he beloved starring within the High School Musical sequence, he likely wouldn't take that role today. To his credit score, the reason why Grabeel would cross on his HSM position as of late is a brilliant one.

"There's so many amazingly talented gay actors that could do it as well, so if High School Musical was made today, I don't know if I would play Ryan. I would love to, but the last thing I want to do is take an opportunity away from other people," he added. "As a straight white man, I know that even without trying, I have taken opportunities away from other people."

Later all the way through that same TMZ interview, Lucas Grabeel printed that High School Musical director Kenny Ortega instructed him that having an openly gay persona in a childâs film wouldnât fly right through the 2000s. "He was like, 'Well, I mean, it's a touchy subject sometimes with children's programming â I'm not sure if Disney is ready now for that kind of thing. I absolutely agree that he is and I think we have an opportunity here to showcase a real person." Considering Ortega is gay, it must have been painful for him to deal with that situation especially since there have been many great LGBTQ+ characters and that neighborhood merits illustration.
